content:
Napoleon Bonaparte's height has been a subject of debate and misconception for many years. The belief that he was short stems from a misinterpretation of French measurement units during his time. In reality, Napoleon was of average height for his era.

According to historical records, Napoleon's height was recorded as 5 feet 2 inches in French units. However, this measurement corresponds to approximately 5 feet 7 inches in modern English units, which was above average height in 18th and 19th century France. The confusion arises because the French inch was longer than the English inch used today.

So, to answer your question: No, Napoleon Bonaparte was not short; he was of average height for his time.
